### Nanoparticle drug delivery for brain tumors
Recent advances in nanoparticle‑mediated drug delivery have demonstrated substantial therapeutic benefits for brain tumors. Polymeric nanoparticles carrying temozolomide prolonged mouse survival by 45%, while lipid‑based carriers functionalized with transferrin successfully traversed the blood‑brain barrier and targeted glioma tissue. Gold nanoparticles decorated with peptide X achieved up to 70% tumor reduction in orthotopic models, and mesoporous silica nanocarriers offered controlled release and further survival gains. Additionally, polymeric micelle encapsulation of paclitaxel yielded a 60% increase in survival relative to the free drug, underscoring the potential of nanocarrier systems to enhance chemotherapy efficacy.

### Nanoparticle drug delivery for brain tumors
Recent advances in nanoparticle‑mediated drug delivery have demonstrated substantial therapeutic benefits for brain tumors. Polymeric nanoparticles carrying temozolomide prolonged mouse survival by 45%, while lipid‑based carriers functionalized with transferrin successfully traversed the blood‑brain barrier and targeted glioma tissue. Gold nanoparticles decorated with peptide X achieved up to 70% tumor reduction in orthotopic models, and mesoporous silica nanocarriers offered controlled release and further survival gains. Additionally, polymeric micelle encapsulation of paclitaxel yielded a 60% increase in survival relative to the free drug, underscoring the potential of nanocarrier systems to enhance chemotherapy efficacy.
